intro: Schradera marginalis, commonly known as the marginal schradera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Schradera marginalis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats. Its botanical features make it a notable species for both ecological and ornamental purposes.
